items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Short-Term Hourly, Substitute, Professional Expert & Athletic Support Services, Student Assistant and Volunteer personnel actions as submitted.

items.item_details:
Education Code 81655 stipulates that no contract is an enforceable obligation of the District until it has been approved by the Board of Trustees.  District Policy adopted on April 10, 2007 establishes the authority of certain administrators to approve contracts under the bid limit prior to formal Board approval.  All contracts and purchase orders exceeding the bid limit (current bid limit is $81,000) should have prior Board approval as a separate board item.
	 
This consent item presents for Board approval: all purchase orders for this period, which includes purchase orders for administratively approved contracts exceeding $1,000, as well as additional contracts that, although are not executed by way of purchase order, are deemed appropriate to be added by the Purchasing Department.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees ratify the contracts and purchase orders for the period of September 10, 2012 through October 9, 2012 as noted in the attached documents.

items.item_details: The $10,000 grant will benefit students enrolled in the Early Childhood Education classes and seeking a new or maintaining a currently held Child Development permit.  Student fees will be paid by the grant, or if student has Financial Aid they will receive an amount to offset the cost of their textbooks.

items.item_details: The State Contract for Child Care services is for a proscribed amount of days.  Due to a gas leak, and subsequent closure of St. Elizabeth's while the leak was being found, repaired, inspected and permitted, the school was not open the Minimum Days of Operation required by the State of California.  If the Board approves the closure, the closure days would not be counted toward the MDO target, and SJCC will not have to return excess funds received.  The amount retained would be $55,312.  We only recently learned of the requirement for Board approval.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accept and approve the Emergency closing of St. Elizabeth's Day Home in January 2012.
items.item_text: Emergency Closure for St. Elizabeth's Day Home - January 4, 2012 to June 13, 2012

items.item_details:
This contract will replace the current contract already approved and in place for this fiscal year, based on the augmentation of additional funding from the State Department of Education. 
	 
Saint Elizabeth's Day Home is a California nonprofit charitable public benefit corporation.  As the certified CDE contractor, SJCC will continue to meet the condition of its contract with the CDE, Child Development Division and to adhere to the Funding terms and conditions.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accept and approve the contract attached in order to sub-contract the State Department of Education Grants to St. Elizabeth's Day Home.

items.item_details:
In May 2012 SJCC submitted a request for funding for facility renovation for our sub-contractor St. Elizabeth's.  The project identified was that of replacing a substrate layer of the playgrounds on site at St. Elizabeth's.  The amount which would be funded would be no more than 30% of the total estimate.
	 
Application was approved and funded.  Board approval will allow SJCC to appropriate funds and pay St. Elizabeth's for work completed, based on invoices.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accept and approve the appropriation of $3,866 for Facility renovation.

items.item_details: This request represents an increase to the grant previously approved by the Board earlier this year from the initial amount of $253,787.  Most of the funds will be used by the subcontractor, St. Elizabeth's Day Home, 4% will be retained by the college.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accept and approve the appropriation of the augmented contract from the State.

items.item_details:
ACCEPT AS INFORMATION ITEMS 
Project Highlights 
EVC Program Update
Presentation by Gilbane Building Company to update the Board on projects related to the Measure G-2010 Bond Program as implemented at Evergreen Valley College.   
	 
Monthly Measure G-2010 Summary Report through October 31, 2012 
Attached please find the Measure G-2010 Summary Report through October   31, 2012.
	 
APPROVE AS ACTION ITEMS 
Contracts
	 
Construction Agreement – BHM CONSTRUCTION, INC. - Construction Services for EVC Interim Police Facility and Measure G-2010 PM/CM Offices.
	 
On September 11, 2012 the Board approved the purchase of certain portable buildings for use as 1) interim housing of the Police Department during the construction of the new Police Station adjacent to the Central Plant building at EVC, and 2) for program/construction management offices for the Measure G-2010 program manager.  The Board is asked to approve the award of a construction contract for the relocation and installation of those purchased facilities.  Bids were received for this work on November 8, 2012 for this work.  BHM CONSTRUCTION, INC. from Vallejo, CA is the lowest responsible bidder in the amount of $1,108,300.  (Refer to the attached bid spreadsheet.)  The budget for this work is $1,124,390.
	 
The Board is asked to approve the award of a contract to BHM CONSTRUCTION, INC. in the amount of $1,108,300 for construction services to relocate District owned portable buildings for Interim Police and Measure G-2010 PM/CM offices at EVC. 
	 
Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) – KITCHELL CEM INC. – EVC South Campus Development Enhanced Commissioning Agent (CxA) Services.
	 
To support the sustainability effort during the design and construction of the South Campus Development at EVC, it is necessary to secure commissioning services related to mechanical and electrical systems.  This is a requirement to obtain LEED Silver Certification as required by the District for new building construction.   Proposals were sought from the firms pre-approved by the Board on August 14, 2012. Based on the responses received, it is recommended that KITCHELL CEM INC. be awarded a contract for Enhanced Commissioning services to support the design and construction of the South Campus Development project.
	 
The Board is asked to approve the award of a contract to KITCHELL CEM INC. in the amount of $96,820 for Enhanced Commissioning Agent (CxA) Services for the EVC South Campus Development project. 
	 
Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) – KITCHELL CEM INC. – EVC Central Plant and Police Station Renovation Commissioning Agent (CxA) Services.
	 
To support sustainability efforts during the design and construction of the Central Plant and Police Station Renovation at EVC, it is necessary to secure commissioning services related to mechanical and electrical systems.  Proposals were sought from the firms approved by the Board on August 14, 2012 and based on the responses received it is recommended that KITCHELL CEM INC. be awarded a contract for Commissioning services to support the design and construction of the Central Plant and Police Station Renovation project.
	 
The Board is asked to approve the award of a contract to KITCHELL CEM INC. in the amount of $59,227 for Commissioning Agent (CxA) Services at the Central Plant and Police Station Renovation Project. 
	 
	 
Contract Revisions and Changes 
	 
PAA EVC-01 Revision No. 01 – CSW/STUBER-STROEH ENGINEERING GROUP, INC. (CSW/ST2) –EVC and District Offices Utility Mapping
	 
During the course of providing utility mapping services at EVC, certain drain system access points were found to be clogged with silt, debris and vegetation.  To complete the mapping, it is considered most expedient for CSW/STUBER-STROEH ENGINEERING GROUP, INC. (CSW/ST2) to provide services that will remove these obstructions and allow them access to measure the depth of the approximately 16 inlets affected.
	 
Original agreement - $251,851
Revision No. 01 - $5,532 (add)
Revised contract value - $257,383.   
	 
The Board is asked to approve issuance of a PAA revision to CSW/STUBER-STROEH ENGINEERING GROUP, INC. (CSW/ST2) in the amount of $5,532 for the EVC and District Offices Utility Mapping Project.
	 
PAA EVC-01 Revision No. 1 – MEYER+SILBERBERG LANDSCAPE ARCHITECTS – EVC Landscape Programming & Assessment Services
	 
During the month of October there were three instances of tree branches falling to the ground.  While no persons or buildings were damaged, the College requested that an immediate hazard evaluation be performed of trees that may be at risk of further failure.  MEYER+SILBERBERG LANDSCAPE ARCHITECTS was already under contract to perform a tree assessment, so this was done soon thereafter.  The resulting report finds that there are numerous trees requiring immediate attention.  This revision to the Meyer+Silberberg PAA provides for the preparation of the necessary bid documents and specifications required to remedy this issue.  
	 
Original agreement - $322,770
Revision No. 01 - $2,750 (add)
Revised contract value - $325,520.   
	 
The Board is asked to approve issuance of a PAA revision to MEYER+SILBERBERG LANDSCAPE ARCHITECTS in the amount of $2,750 to the EVC Landscape Programming & Assessment Services Project.
	 
	 
Bond List Revisions 
	 
None
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accept the Information Items and approve the Action Items, which include Contracts, and Contract Revisions and Changes.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program Updates, Highlights, Summary Reports, Contracts, and Project Assignment Amendments
items.item_text_raw: 1. Measure G-2010 Bond Program Updates, Highlights, Summary Reports, Contracts, and Project Assignment Amendments

items.item_details:
This item presents a summary of Measure G 2010 Project Team’s efforts in developing two distinct options for consideration to replace the existing aging and deteriorating District Office facility.  Staff believes that the information presented to date on these options clearly indicates that the purchase and renovation of an existing off-campus facility is the most cost effective and viable option to meet the District’s current and future space needs.  A careful assessment and cost analysis associated with the construction of a new facility on District owned property, while possible, would not meet the space and program requirements needs of the board and staff given the budget allocated for this purpose.
Staff also believes that it would be in the best interest of the District to invest all future staff time and District resources in the pursuit of a single option.  The review and consideration of dual options presents a challenge not only to staff resources but also to the budgetary resources associated with this project.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees direct staff to solely dedicate resources and efforts to pursue an off-campus commercially available property to serve as the future District Office.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 District Office Relocation Project Update
items.item_text_raw: 2. Measure G-2010 District Office Relocation Project Update

items.item_details: This project will be located on the San Jose City College campus and will house the new gymnasiums and associated facilities for the Physical Education complex.  Also included in the project scope will be adjacent site and landscaping, faculty and staff offices, and other related support spaces.  The project will be located on a relatively level site and will have utility connections available within close proximity to the building.  Final design of the project will be based on input from an end-user committee and will be consistent with the design guidelines of the overall campus master plan.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Project Authorization Amendment #2 between San Jose/Evergreen Community College District and LPAS, Inc. to complete the project on San Jose City College campus for associated facilities for the Physical Education programs.

items.item_details: On June 25, 2012, The California Assembly passed ACR No. 97 which designates November 2012 as Sikh American Awareness and Appreciation Month. It is recommended the Board of Trustees approve Resolution No. 112712-2 in support of ACR No. 97.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Resolution No. 112712-2 to designate November 2012 as Sikh American Awareness and Appreciation Month.

The FY 2012/2013 First Quarter Budget Report was provided under separate cover.  The report can also be accessed by the public on the District's website at http://www.sjeccd.edu/BUSINESS/ADMINSERVICES/Pages/BudgetReports.aspx.

items.item_details:
California Code of Regulations Section 58305(d) requires districts to prepare an Annual Financial and Budget Report (CCFS-311) to the State Chancellor's Office.  The report is the vehicle for summarizing and communicating the results of budgetary decisions and transactions of all governmental, proprietary, and fiduciary funds for the fiscal year.  The information is then compiled system-wide by the State Chancellor's Office.
	 
The attached Fiscal Year 2011-2012 Annual Financial and Budget Report (CCFS-311) is presented to the Board of Trustees as an information item.
items.item_text: 2011-2012 Annual Financial and Budget Report (CCFS-311)
items.item_text_raw: 2. 2011-2012 Annual Financial and Budget Report (CCFS-311)

items.item_details:
Administrative Procedure 6380 stipulates that the “District’s goal is to remove any and all barriers to a full and equal opportunity for minority-owned and [women]-owned businesses to provide products and services to the District… No vendor shall be excluded from consideration for, or award of, District purchases on the basis of ethnic group identification, race, color, language, accent, immigration status, ancestry, national origin, age, gender, religion, sexual orientation, transgender, marital status, veteran status, physical or mental disability, or on the basis of these characteristics or association with a person or group with one or more of these characteristics.”
	 
This analysis compares five years of information (from FY 2007-2008 to FY 2011-2012) on the diversity of the District’s vendors who chose to self –identify on the District’s Business Enterprise Certification form. The attached analysis represents:
Vendor Count - The number of vendors in each category regardless of the dollar value.
# of Vendors – The number of different vendors in each category.
CY Distr – Current Year Distribution in each category.
PY Growth – Prior Year Growth in each category.
Amount Paid (in Thousands)
Amount Paid – The amount paid to vendors representing each category.
CY Distr – Current Year Distribution in each category.
PY Growth – Prior Year Growth in each category.
With the budget appropriation of Measure G 2010 in FY 2011-2012 and the start of projects in relation to this new funding source, overall discretionary expenditures has increased. Among vendors who chose to self-identify, there was a 163% increase in expenditure from FY 2010-2011. This increase has resulted in a 22% growth of small business expenditures from FY 2010-2011. Furthermore, amid race of businesses, the Asian/Pacific Islander group increased 27% from FY 2010-2011.
	 
The District recognizes the importance of supplier diversity and by creating sound business relationships, will continue to strengthen the economic development and viability for minority-owned, women-owned and small businesses utilizing workshops, such as the Equal Opportunity Contracting Open House hosted by the District and Gilbane on February 16, 2012. Gilbane’s Program Coordinator performs a key role by providing outreach, training and educational programs in regards to Measure G 2010 projects. Although only targeting Measure G 2010 projects, skills obtained through these programs can also be used to compete for contracts outside of Measure G 2010 projects.
